title: Can you report if...?
body: Can you report player that picked something he wanted, that was not healthy for team, after he asked (etc.: tank or mage) and his team responded opposite of what he picked?

replies.body: but isn't it "refusing to communicate with teammates" ?i know that option is gone now, but still, now don't get me wrong i don't mean if hes good with that champ, but if hes "brain dead" you know going 1 v tank and adc and most fed champ in enemy team when hes Broke and squishy.

When you play reasonably close to or within the meta, there is a certain amount of unspoken communication and team coordination already present because your team can expect certain things from you without you actually saying anything. If you pick a mage top lane when your team wants/needs a tank (for example), you will likely still be filling the top lane role to an extent that the team understands what you're doing; if you decide to go double mid against the wishes of your actual mid laner, *then* there's a problem.

I assume you're referring the the "Smite Nunu Support" situation. There's a huge difference between picking a tank when your team doesn't need/want one, and playing double jungle when you queued up as/are assigned Support. No, you can't be punished for picking a bad team comp (whether it's subjective or objectively bad).

Use your best judgement for reports. If the player is causing your team considerable grief by playing way outside what is intended and expected, report accordingly. Reports are in essence your "vote" for what kind of behavior should be punished, so vote to make the game a better place.

[Also this guide to reporting](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752884-Reporting-a-Player)

You cannot report someone for not picking the champion you or your team wants. You can however report someone for not playing the role as intended if the team doesn't agree to his decision. 

Example: Abandoning bottom lane to go support top and create massive pressure leading to the first blood tower while keeping someone like Fiora from getting any farm and therefore scaling into the game is a viable strategy that would result in you winning the majority of the time especially if your marksman chooses someone like Ezreal and farms using his Q against a non aggressive lane (support soraka for example). Your team HAS TO agree to it though.

Cant report people for being bad until it drifts into pure, clear and obvious intentional feeding or trolling.

Yes you can now according to riot. If enough people on your team decide they want someone to play a specific type of champion, and the other player doesn't, you are encouraged to report them for creating a negative experience for the team as a whole, as well as not sufficiently communicating with the team. If enough people end up reporting that person over time, they will be manually audited.
